An institute to support academic & community collaborations in the digital humanities
Hosted by the Institute for Digital Research in the Humanities
University of Kansas, Lawrence, KS
June 6-11, 2022

About

This week-long summer Institute will provide foundational knowledge, skills and resources to successfully advance 12 public humanities projects, increasing their longevity, visibility and impact. This will be followed by a year of further online training & support.

More ›

Sessions

The curriculum features a mix of case studies of model projects, technical training and interactive workshops & discussion to strengthen relationships & collaborations, create sustainable digital projects, and develop practical knowledge of methods and tools.

More ›

Instructors

The Institute sessions will be led by more than 20 experienced academics and community partners, offering a breadth of complementary skill sets and areas of expertise that will provide participants rich opportunities for learning and engagement.

More ›

Apply

The Institute invites one academic and one community partner per project to apply by Monday, January 31, 2022.

Apply

The Public Digital Humanities Institute has been made possible by a major grant from the National Endowment for the Humanities: Democracy demands wisdom. Any views, findings, conclusions, or recommendations expressed in this website do not necessarily represent those of the National Endowment for the Humanities.
